EXHIBIT A

Payment for Breach – Illustrative Example

The following example illustrates the cap on indemnity payments contained in Section 3(c)(iii) of this Agreement. Under Section 3(c)(iii), the liability of Blackstone under Sections 3(a)(i), 3(a)(ii) and 3(a)(iii) of this Agreement shall not exceed, in aggregate, (A) the product of (x) the Built-In Gain as of the Effective Date and (y) the highest Effective Tax Rate in effect at the time of any Breach, divided by (B) one hundred percent minus such Effective Tax Rate.

Assuming that (a) the Built-In Gain as of the Effective Date is $2.5 billion and (b) there have been Breaches where the Effective Tax Rate in effect at the time of such Breaches was 18%, 15%, 21%, respectively, such that the highest Effective Tax Rate in effect at the time of any Breach is 21%, then the cap on Blackstone’s liability under Sections 3(a)(i), 3(a)(ii) and 3(a)(iii) of this Agreement is calculated as follows:

1. Built-In Gain: $2.5 billion.

2. Highest Effective Tax Rate: 21%.

3. (A) equal to product of (x) Built-In Gain and (y) Effective Tax Rate: $525 million.

4. (B) equal to one hundred percent minus the highest Effective Tax Rate: 79%.

5. Cap on indemnity payments equal to (A) divided by (B): $664.56 million.

The indemnity payment shown above is rounded to the nearest hundredth decimal place solely for convenience and varies from the actual indemnity payment.

The parties to the Agreement acknowledge and agree that the example above is based on assumptions and that the actual amount of the cap on Blackstone’s liability will be calculated appropriately to reflect (i) the actual Built-In Gain as of the Effective Date and (ii) and highest Effective Tax Rate at time of any Breach.

EXHIBIT J

PARENT DEBT GUARANTY TERMS

 

J-1

Parent Debt Guaranty

Required Provisions

The parties will in good faith consider changes to this Exhibit that the Parent proposes prior to Closing, provided no such changes shall be made unless in all cases they are acceptable to the lenders of the Debt Financing and the providers of the non consolidation opinion and true lease opinion.

I. Defined Terms

 

A.

“Collateral” means all collateral and/or security for the Loan granted or pledged to Lender pursuant to the Loan Documents, including, without limitation, the [Mortgaged Property] [APPROPRIATE DEFINED TERM TO BE INSERTED BASED ON THE LOAN DOCUMENTS].

 

B.

“Conditions Precedent” has the meaning set forth below.

 

C.

“Debt” means the unpaid principal amount of the Loan and all interest accrued and unpaid thereon, but excluding, for the avoidance of doubt, any amounts other than principal and interest due thereon.

 

D.

“Fair Market Value” means the difference between (A) price at which the Collateral would be sold for cash by a willing seller not compelled to sell to a willing buyer not compelled to buy, taking into account all relevant factors, but assuming for purposes of determination of such price that the Collateral were sold unencumbered by the Loan, as agreed by Lender and Guarantor; provided that, if Lender and Guarantor are unable to agree upon the Fair Market Value, then as determined in accordance with the provisions of the Dispute Resolution Section below, less (B) the reasonable costs that would reasonably be anticipated to be incurred by a seller in connection with a sale of the Collateral.

 

E.

“Guaranteed Obligations” means the Debt.

 

F.

“Guarantor” means MGM RESORTS INTERNATIONAL, a Delaware corporation and any successor by operation of law.

 

G.

“Loan” means [DEFINITION TO BE INSERTED].

 

H.

“Loan Documents” means all documents evidencing, securing and/or pertaining to the Loan.

 

I.

“Qualified Appraiser” means an appraiser who (i) is a member of the Master Appraiser Institute (or its successor or equivalent), (ii) has not less than ten (10) years’ experience in appraising gaming properties, and (iii) is not, and during the preceding five (5) years has not been, an employee, officer, director or member of Guarantor or Lender or any of their respective Affiliates.

 

J-2

II. Operative Provisions

 

1.

Guaranty.

 

  a.

Guarantor hereby irrevocably, absolutely and unconditionally guarantees to Lender the full, prompt and complete payment when due of the Guaranteed Obligations.

 

  b.

This Guaranty shall constitute a guaranty of collection (as contemplated pursuant to Section 3-416(2) of the Uniform Commercial Code as in effect in the State of New York as of the date hereof (the “NY UCC”)). For the avoidance of doubt, this Guaranty shall not constitute a guaranty of payment (as contemplated under Section 3-416(1) of the NY UCC).

 

2.

Limitations. Lender expressly acknowledges and agrees that the scope of Guarantor’s obligations under this Guaranty are limited to the payment of an amount equal to the unpaid portion of the Guaranteed Obligations and Guarantor shall have no other or further obligation under this Guaranty or under the Loan Documents whatsoever in respect of any act or omission, whether in respect of payment, performance or otherwise, of Borrower or any other obligor of the Debt, or any of their respective employees, agents, representatives, officers or directors in connection with the Loan, whether based on contract, tort, negligence, strict liability, delay, warranty, indemnity, error and omission or otherwise.

 

3.

Duration. This Guaranty shall remain in effect until the earlier of the satisfaction of the Guaranteed Obligations or the date the Debt has been repaid in full.

 

4.

Conditions Precedent. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Guaranty, no payment shall be due from Guarantor to Lender and the Guaranteed Obligations shall not be due or payable until and unless each of the following conditions precedent shall have been satisfied (collectively, the “Conditions Precedent”):

 

  a.

The Debt shall be due and payable in full and Borrower shall have failed to pay the Debt;

 

  b.

Lender shall have made written demand to Guarantor for payment of the Guaranteed Obligations and, together therewith, shall have provided to Guarantor a detailed computation of the amount of the Guaranteed Obligations, detailed back-up calculations supporting same, and all back-up documentation related thereto; and

 

  c.

Lender shall have asserted, exercised and enforced, to the maximum extent permitted by applicable laws, all rights and remedies to which Lender may be reasonably entitled in respect of the Debt, and shall have exhausted Lender’s efforts to seek repayment of the Loan from all sources other than this Guaranty, including any rights, claims or pursuit of foreclosure or power of sale resulting from such judgment and Lender shall have successfully conducted a foreclosure sale of the Collateral and credited not less than the Fair Market Value to the Debt at such foreclosure sale [LOCAL COUNSEL TO CONFIRM/EXPAND].

 

J-3

5.

Notice. Lender shall provide written notice to Guarantor of each of the following events within five (5) days of the occurrence of any such event:

 

  a.

Any default or Event of Default under the Loan Documents;

 

  b.

Commencement of any remedies against Borrower and/or any other obligor of the Loan; and/or

 

  c.

The filing or notice of a proceeding to initiate a foreclosure sale of, or exercise or pursuit of any power of sale in respect of, the Collateral or any portion thereof.

 

6.

Cooperation. In the event that any Guaranteed Obligations shall become due from Guarantor, Lender shall cooperate in good faith with Guarantor with respect to minimizing the amount of the Guaranteed Obligations due from Guarantor.

 

7.

Dispute Resolution.

 

  a.

If Lender and Guarantor disagree as to the Fair Market Value of the Collateral, then Lender and Guarantor shall negotiate in good faith to reach agreement as to such Fair Market Value and the good faith determination of Guarantor as to same shall be binding absent a determination of the Applicable Value in accordance with the following provisions of this Section.

 

  b.

If Lender and Guarantor are unable to agree on the Fair Market Value of the Collateral, in each case, within thirty (30) days after (1) Lender shall have made written demand to Borrower and Guarantor for payment of any Guaranteed Obligations and (2) all of the Conditions Precedent in respect of such Guaranteed Obligations shall have been satisfied, except as provided in Section 4 above, then either Lender or Guarantor (such party, the “Requesting Party”) shall have the right to notify the other party (such other party, the “Notice Party”) that such Requesting Party is initiating the process to resolve such disagreement and determine the Fair Market Value of the Collateral (the “Applicable Value”), which Applicable Value shall be determined as follows:

 

  i.

Lender and Guarantor shall each appoint a Qualified Appraiser and provide notice to the other of such appointment. The other party shall appoint a Qualified Appraiser within thirty (30) days after receiving such notice. If either Lender or Guarantor shall have failed to appoint a Qualified Appraiser or notify the other of such appointment prior to such date and thereafter shall continue to fail to so for a period of fifteen (15) days after notice from the party that appointed a Qualified Appraiser (and so notified the other party), then the second Qualified Appraiser shall be appointed by the American Arbitration Association or its successor (the branch office of which is located in or closest to Las Vegas, NV), upon request of either party. Each of the Qualified Appraiser appointed by Lender (the “Lender Appraiser”) and the Qualified Appraiser appointed by Guarantor (the “Guarantor Appraiser”) shall submit its determination of the Applicable Value within sixty (60) days following the appointment and notification of the second of such appraisers.

 

J-4

  ii.

If the greater of the Applicable Value as determined by either the Lender Appraiser or the Guarantor Appraiser is equal to or less than one hundred ten percent (110%) of the lesser of the Applicable Value as determined by the Lender Appraiser or the Applicable Value as determined by the Guarantor Appraiser, then the Applicable Value shall be the arithmetic average of such Applicable Values. If the greater of the Applicable Value as determined by either the Lender Appraiser or the Guarantor Appraiser is greater than one hundred ten percent (110%) of the lesser of the Applicable Value as determined by the Lender Appraiser or the Applicable Value as determined by the Guarantor Appraiser, then the Lender Appraiser and the Guarantor Appraiser shall jointly appoint a third Qualified Appraiser (the “Additional Appraiser”) pursuant to the following provisions of this Section.

 

  iii.

If necessary, within ten (10) Business Days after delivery of the reports of both the Lender Appraiser and the Guarantor Appraiser pursuant to the above provisions of this Section, the Lender Appraiser and the Guarantor Appraiser shall meet to appoint an Additional Appraiser. The Lender Appraiser and the Guarantor Appraiser shall each bring to such meeting a list of five (5) Qualified Appraisers that it proposes. At such meeting, such lists shall be exchanged and the Lender Appraiser and the Guarantor Appraiser shall select any Qualified Appraiser that is on both lists as the Additional Appraiser. If no Qualified Appraiser is on both lists, then the Lender Appraiser and the Guarantor Appraiser shall each select a Qualified Appraiser from the other’s list, and the Qualified Appraisers so selected shall choose the Additional Appraiser. If for any reason the Additional Appraiser has not been selected, or if selected has not agreed to serve, by the date that is thirty (30) days after delivery of the reports of both Ground Lessee Appraiser and Ground Lessor Appraiser pursuant to this Section, then either Lender or Guarantor may request the American Arbitration Association or its successor (the branch office of which is located in or closest to Las Vegas, NV) to appoint the Additional Appraiser.

 

  iv.

During the sixty (60) day period following its appointment, the Additional Appraiser shall determine the Applicable Value by choosing either the Applicable Value submitted by the Lender Appraiser or the Applicable Value submitted by the Guarantor Appraiser. The Additional Appraiser must select one of the two Applicable Values and may not select any other value.

 

  v.

Any documents or other written information provided by Lender or Guarantor to its Qualified Appraiser shall also concurrently be provided to any other Qualified Appraiser.

 

  vi.

Guarantor shall pay all costs and expenses of the Guarantor Appraiser, Lender shall pay all costs and expenses of the Lender Appraiser, and Guarantor and Lender shall evenly split the costs and expenses of the Additional Appraiser.

 

J-5

8.

Governing Law. This Guaranty, and all claims or causes of action (whether in contract, tort or statute) that may be based upon, arise out of or relate to this Guaranty, or the negotiation, execution or performance of this Guaranty, shall be governed by, and enforced in accordance with, the internal laws of the State of New York, without giving effect to any laws, rules or provisions of the State of New York that would cause the application of the laws, rules or provisions of any jurisdiction other than the State of New York.

 

J-6
